Joshua Krautwurst

Web Application Developer

joshua@krautwur.st 828.606.7116 http://dev.krautwur.st

Objective

As a developer, my primary goal is to create clean, cutting-edge, engaging interfaces which empower users to more easily and effectively glean the information they need, when they need it.

The internet's rapid, ever-growing prevalence has directly and profoundly enhanced our ability to draw and create meaningful relationships within and between the people, things, and ideas around us. However, without effective mechanisms for comprehension and manipulation, attempting to interact with this massive swell in descriptive and relational data is a nearly impossible task.

Each end user's experience is a complex culmination of user context, careful interactive design, and accessibility considerations—all of which hinge upon a developer's ability to be both empathetic and efficient. By doing my damndest to improve the end product's enjoyability and interactivity, I am constantly pushing myself to advance the state of the web.

Employment History

The Garrigan Lyman Group

Developer

July 2013 - Present

In my time as a FTE developer at The Garrigan Lyman group, I've taken the reins as development lead on large-scale projects for companies such as T-Mobile, Microsoft, Rick Steves' Europe, Toyo Tires, Simon G Jewelry, TrueBlue Inc, and more. I've specialized in creating enjoyable, interactive interfaces which take advantage of bleeding-edge technologies. I've also led in-house education workshops on Sass, responsive design, mobile-first strategy, web performance, and JavaScript design patterns.

The Garrigan Lyman Group

Contract Developer

September 2012 - July 2013

As a contract developer for The Garrigan Lyman Group, I provided support development for large-scale enterprise projects. I proved myself proactive, serving as a thought leader and advocating the stronger implementation of best practices. My consistently high level of performance led to two raises and a full-time employment offer within nine months.

BlueTone Media

Web Developer

May 2011 - September 2012

At BlueTone Media, I worked for small and medium-sized businesses, building promotional websites and vigorously expanding my knowledge base.

BlueTone Media

Web Developer (Intern)

January 2011 - May 2011

Originally hired on for data entry and light maintenance, this internship allowed me to flourish as a developer and led to an offer as a full-time member of the company.

The University of North Carolina at Wilmington

More about me

In addition to my passion for development, I am an avid musician, gardener, and Creator of Things. Any remaining leisure time is distributed pretty equally between my girlfriend and two dogs.
